Abstract: Recent advancements in electroporation technologies have significantly impacted both research and clinical applications, bridging the gap from bench to clinic. This review highlights the latest developments in pulsed field ablation, transfection, gene therapy, electrochemotherapy, and microfluidics. These innovations have enhanced the precision, efficiency, and safety of electroporation, enabling targeted therapeutic delivery and improved patient outcomes. The integration of microfluidic systems has further miniaturized and automated electroporation processes, facilitating high-throughput applications. Collectively, these advancements underscore the transformative potential of electroporation technologies in advancing biomedical research and therapeutic interventions.
